alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 12 at 2:44PM MST until September 12 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Pima County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 445 PM MST. * At 244 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the southwestern portions of the Rincon Mountains. Radar estimates that between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the Rincon Creek and Aqua Verde Creek watersheds. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tucson, Vail and Saguaro National Park East. This includes the following streams and drainages... Pantano Wash, Agua Verde Creek, Cienega Creek, Paige Creek, Rincon Creek and Coyote Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
